Parchments, Please.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: So, you're the squirt that runs this place now?
Ehehehe, little young I'd say, but I suppose we'll see in time.
I'm <color=#CC18C9>Deidre Downton</color>- but you probably knew that. After all, my brewing prowess is unrivaled across all of Kastonia!
But don't get too starstruck dearie- so long as you keep my lips wet, you and I will be square!
By the way... I don't see your bartending certification hung up anywhere. That might prove to be an issue.
Don't get me wrong- I'll still be ordering something. Just figured you might want to rectify that quickly, ehehehe~

Deidre can Help.Name: Deidre can Help
Stanzas: Hmm? You're looking at me funny, dearie.
Ehehe! Then again, you always look funny.
You're concerned about the quake from earlier, hmm? Don't fret, why don't you let Auntie Deidre go figure it out?
I'll be back tomorrow with everything you need to know. Just hand me that little quest contract and I'll be on my way... after you give me a little something to drink for the trouble.

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Morning, dearie. Glad to see your bar starting to flourish with each passing day!
Of course, you have a long way to go before you reach my level of success, hmm?
Ehehehe... for future notice, the quicker you serve me a drink, the quicker I'll quit teasing you!

Day4College.Name: Day4College
Stanzas: I could've sworn that mousey little girl who just left bore a sigil of the <color=#01B117>College</color>. You aren't getting yourself into trouble now, are you dearie?

I don't mean it to sound as if I'm speaking ill of the <color=#01B117>College</color>. It's just that earning political favor is a balance- and you'll want to know who's at the other end of that scale, ehehehe...
But enough of that. I don't just come to flap my gums at you!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: Hmm? You want me to go on a quest? Again? Let me take a look.
Sweetheart, do I look like a diplomat? I'd probably bite their ears off! Ehehehe~
But Ol' Auntie Deidre has a few tricks up her really baggy sleeves.
If you mix two ingredients of the same type, it'll give the guzzler a temporary perk.
It may not be what they order, but they'll feel the effects of the drink regardless.
For a quest requiring, ohhhh, socializing, add two <color=yellow>Skybursts</color> to the drink you give me.
Experiment with drink combinations to give different buffs.
Maybe you'll even find a patron's favorite drink!
Hehe, the little things you learn while brewing.

Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Well look at you! Playing a little game of politics between mice and men, hmm?
Ehehehe, I'm only teasing dearie- don't get your feathers in a ruffle!
...why is that journalist giving me a dirty look...?
You do what you think is right my dear, and just remember that you can always lean on auntie Deidre for help!
That is, so long as you remember our little agreement, hoo hoo...

Day6Experiment-Ask.Name: Day6Experiment-Ask
Stanzas: I got a riddle for you, dearie... if you can wrap your little head around it.
What's unstable, can be drunk, and now the people think is junk?
My potions! Ech! Last night, a whole batch of them exploded for no reason!
I haven't made a failed potion in years! What if I'd sold one to a patron? They could have blown up in my face!
Then I'd have to go and clean their guts from my walls!
Ech! Though I am in a terrible gut shortage at the moment... Ehehehe!
Strange thing is, just the other day, a patron returned those SAME potions complaining they had no effect! Same ingredients, same recipe.
The sooner they fix the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, the sooner I can go back to making safe potions.

Day6Relic.Name: Day6Relic
Stanzas: Ech! Can't an old woman walk around without a chunk of stone crushing her?
Another piece fell last night! Right by my shop!
And, to make matters worse, there was a tin man running along with a glowing scepter by the Spire!
I think the tin man had something to do with it. Him, and the little figure running beside him.
You know what else I think? I think they were both heading here... to see YOU!
So, Squirt. You want to know what I think about you?
You and me? We both enjoy being up to no good! Ehehehe~

Day6Eyes.Name: Day6Eyes
Stanzas: Squirt, what did you do last night?
Strange people knocked on my door asking for you. They wanted to have a, ehehe, a 'nice little chat.'
I don't know why they came to me. Maybe because I helped you deliver the piece of the Codex.
See what you got me into, Squirt? These people weren't tin men or mousey scientists. They were... CLASSY!
They said something about a new age and a fresh start and that, apparently, you're prying into it all.
I told them they pried me out of my bed, and if they didn't leave soon, they'd never live past the current age.
You should've been there to see them scurry off. Ehehehe~
I just thought you should know. Don't get yourself into too much trouble now, dearie!

Day6CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Guards are in quite the hustle this morning. You wouldn't have had anything to do with that, would you, dearie?
I should certainly hope not- it's not wise to make a foe out of the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>, ehehehe!
But if you DID happen to do something foolish, don't fret, your Auntie Deidre's always here to make things better.
All you need to do is ask...

Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Goodness, those two sure left in a huff, didn't they? You aren't playing with fire again, are you dearie?
The <color=#01B117>College</color> isn't on great terms with the Coproreal, especially since one of their own got snatched up last night!
...how do I know that? Come now dearie, you should know by now that rumors scarcely pass me by... oohoohoo!
I don't mean to brag, but I'm quite the formidable ally. *wink*
...an ally who's feeling particularly parched right now!

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: What's up, barkeep? By the way, I should probably introduce myself- you'll be seeing a lot of me!
Name's <color=#00FF7F>Artemis Cagosh</color>, but that's such a mouthful. You should just call me <color=#00FF7F>Artie</color>.
And don't worry- this thing ain't for bashin' skulls- well, not yours, at least!
It's mainly for gettin' rid of some of the more hefty chunks of rock down in the mines... heh, you know what I mean?
Er, sorry- didn't mean to talk your ear off.
What, you need me to pick something up from City Hall? Well sure, pal! A quick drink might be appreciated though.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: Man, you won't believe the day I had, barkeep...
Or, uh, maybe you will, dependin' on whether or not you felt that quake from here, heh.
Point is, the mines've collapsed, and I'm outta work for a bit.
Not really sure what to do in the meantime, but figure a drink might help me for a bit.

Artie Can Help.Name: Artie Can Help
Stanzas: Say, barkeep? Without a job, I don't have much to do.
If there's anything I can help you with, lemme know.
I ain't good at much, but I got a muscle or two I can leverage.
That is, so long as I'm hydrated, hah!

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Hey pal! Glad to see a friendly face, 'specially considerin' the recent events.
Everyone's losin' their heads over this Spire thing, and I gotta tell you, I'm not quite sure what to make of it.
I just wish there was a way to help more, y'know?
Anyways, pass me a drink- gotta hankerin' for one of your brews!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: People are asking what's goin' on, and, to be honest with ya, I am too.
People want answers, and they want 'em now. And it ain't like the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are being exactly transparent.
But if ya ask me Barkeep, I don't think anyone knows what's goin' on, and we oughta just help each other through all this.
I'm not the religious type or anything, but the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are a wise bunch- about as wise as the <color=#01B117>College</color> is smart.
Ohh! Sorry. Didn't mean to go on so long!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Hey pal! Beautiful day, isn't it?
I mean, I guess besides all the commotion goin' on in the center of town and whatnot. But hey, least the sun is out, hah!
Kind of sets me in the mood to get outdoors and DO something, y'know? I'm not gettin' as active ever since the mines collapsed!
But you pro'lly don't wanna hear me moanin' all day, now do ya?

Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Hey pal! Beautiful day, isn't it?
I mean, I guess besides all the commotion goin' on in the center of town and whatnot. But hey, least the sun is out, hah!
Kind of sets me in the mood to get outdoors and DO something, y'know? I'm not gettin' as active ever since the mines collapsed!
But you pro'lly don't wanna hear me moanin' all day, now do ya?

Unemployment.Name: Unemployment
Stanzas: Sorry, Barkeep. I'm not really in a talking mood now.
Money's running shorter each day, and I'm not sure how much longer I can go.
You'll have to put this one on my tab.

Day6ContractArtie.Name: Day6ContractArtie
Stanzas: Hey, Barkeep! I don't- I don't know what to say.
I guess just 'thanks for offering me a job!'
I don't know how much of a help I'll be, but I'll do the best I can!
Gimme a task, anything at all, and I'll be on my way!

Day6GiveGift.Name: Day6GiveGift
Stanzas: I don't know how to say this, but, well, thanks. Thanks a bunch.
I don't know why youd help me out like that. It ain't like I did anything for ya.
But I'll tell you what! When I get on my feet, I'll be sure'n return the favor!
Or, if ya got somethin' for me now, I'll be happy to help!

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: The name's <color=yellow>Horace R. Schuster</color> and, I assure you, the pleasure's all mine.
This is such a quaint little pub you have here- much more modest than the ritzy establishments I'd frequent in my youth!
Those places were so lifeless and ostentatious though, I much more greatly appreciate the modest decor you have here!
But I shan't waste any more of your precious time, and will get straight to the point.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: My goodness! Did you hear that?
'Twas enough to ruin an old man's already poor hearing.
Something that powerful must have impacted dozens of civilians. I'm fortunate to have been here, unaffected. And yet, I now have a responsibility to aid those who were.
Friend, I have always dreamed of becoming an adventurer, but my family business prevented me from doing so. Perhaps this is a chance to change all that.
If you hear of anything that suits my talents, please, allow me to help.
In the meantime, I'd love to partake in another of your finest brews.

Horace Can Help.Name: Horace Can Help
Stanzas: Greetings, friend! I've been told you could use a hand with relief efforts!
Well, fortunately for you, I have, not one, but two hands right here!
I may not have the strength of my youth, but I've found how to wield words over the years.
Come now! First a drink, and then I'll be on my way.

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Ah, there's my favorite bartender. Although it's not as if I frequent any other establishment, ho ho!
Have you been hearing about the protests up in the Borough? I imagine the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> doesn't appreciate the civil unrest at their doorstep one bit!
It makes an old man wish there was more he could do in times like this, to help the next generation.
...it also tends to make me quite parched! Ho ho ho!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: Why, if it isn't my favorite bartender! Although it's not as if I frequent any other establishment, ha ha!
My, my, are you well? Your thoughts seem a journey and a half away!
Pah, the collapse of an old building, magical or not, ought not be cause for alarm.
The people are in good hands between the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>'s aid and the <color=#01B117>College</color>'s research on the matter.
I'm not one for gossip or debate, but I've heard that the <color=#01B117>College</color> and <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are bickering of late.
It seems the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are restricting particular magics from the <color=#01B117>College</color>, who claim it impedes their research.
Nevertheless, those <color=#01B117>College</color> youngesters are smart, and I'm certain they'll get all the information they need before long!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Morning, my friend! With each passing day, the community in this bar seems to grow. Although that small girl in the back seems a bit young to be drinking, does she not...?
Bah, no matter! Surely you are an honorable barkeep, and wouldn't dare serve drinks to minors. I defer the judgement on the matter to you!
That being said, might you be willing to prepare something for your old pal Horace?

Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Perhaps it would be finer if Artie was in better spirits, wouldn't you say?
Perhaps I could help the lad! And, I'll bring some 'spirits' with me to to lift theirs as well. Ha ha!

Day6CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: My my, what's with all the hustle and bustle this morning?
These whippersnappers aren't becoming a bellyache for you, are they? If so, I may just have to meet them at fisticuffs!
Ho ho! I jest... although I do consider myself something of a wordsmith. If someone is in need of a stern talking to, point me in their direction.
I won't have my favorite barkeep harassed over such paltry matters.
Especially since you serve such... *ahem* ...delightful drinks...?

Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: My my, what's with all the hustle and bustle this morning?
These whippersnappers aren't becoming a bellyache for you, are they? If so, I may just have to meet them at fisticuffs!
Ho ho! I jest... although I do consider myself something of a wordsmith. If someone is in need of a stern talking to, point me in their direction.
I won't have my favorite barkeep harassed over such paltry matters.
Especially since you serve such... *ahem* ...delightful drinks...?

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: So you're the altruistic bartender who helped the city guard and the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> last night.
I assume you thought through your decision? The people aren't thrilled about it.
See, I'm an investigative journalist. It's my job to expose the things others don't want exposed.
I'd say your efforts held me back, but that might not be the case. Actually, you might have opened a door.
Speaking of, someone you might find interesting just walked in. I'll take my drink, and be on my way.

Day4College.Name: Day4College
Stanzas: By the gods, have you heard the news? Violent protests at the town center? Suspected government cover-ups?
This would make great headlines for tomorrow's paper! Perhaps a bit too sensational for my editor, however...
Sorry, kind of rude for me not to introduce myself. I'm <color=#B71434>Nell</color>, an investigative journalist from the outer city.
From what I've heard, your establishment is a good place to come for a good story! Keep me in mind, should you ever hear anything.
Anyways, this gal could use a drink. All this excitement has me parched!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: What's up, barkeep? Looks to me as if you've got a full house on your hands today!
You wouldn't mind spilling your secrets, as to how you've gotten so popular, hmm? We could even make an interview out of it!
Hah! I'm just kidding- there's so much going on as of late, I'm up to my beak in article ideas!
Don't worry though- I still find you interesting. Why else would I keep coming back?

Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: My, my. We're the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>'s favorite now, aren't we?
It's no bother to me, but the <color=#01B117>College</color> might start whining.
By the way, if they ever drop by, be sure to ask them about the Flux Experiment.
I'm certain you'll be interested, and yours truly would like to know a little more about it.
Until then, how about a drink and a lead?

Day5CorporealRouteCollege.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCollege
Stanzas: Well, well. It seems the <color=#01B117>College</color> is excited about their new discovery, aren't they? I wonder how they got that information?
It's a good thing the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are understanding. I've been shown forgiveness for many, should I say intrusions? on their privacy.
Not that it'll change what I do.

Day6CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: ...oh, barkeep! Sorry, recent events have got me in a whirlwind of ideas for articles. Have you been following what's going on??
...don't tell me you had a HAND in all this...?! Barkeep, you've GOTTA put me in. I need first-hand accounts of this!
Promise me that if you hear anything else, you'll let me know. You promise, right?
Oh, and a drink. But make it quick! I've got plenty more to write.

Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day6CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: ...oh, barkeep! Sorry, recent events have got me in a whirlwind of ideas for articles. Have you been following what's going on??
...don't tell me you had a HAND in all this...?! Barkeep, you've GOTTA put me in. I need first-hand accounts of this!
Promise me that if you hear anything else, you'll let me know. You promise, right?
Oh, and a drink. But make it quick! I've got plenty more to write.

Shaken, not Deterred.Name: Shaken, not Deterred
Stanzas: I don't mean to, er, interrupt- I imagine you're probably busy! And believe me, I know what it's like to be busy.

But, um... well, my name is <color=#D19F7E>Mavis</color>, and I represent the <color=#01B117>College of Magical Research and Recovery</color>, and, er... I was kind of hoping I could speak to you, regarding the recent protests at City Hall?
It came to our attention (or more specifically, MY attention) that you were involved, to some degree, in helping out. Am I right?
U-um, ahem- I'm just going to make the safe assumption that I am. In which case, we at the <color=#01B117>College</color> would like to thank you for your assistance!
We may not have been able to glean much information from the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>, but they're certainly starting to feel the heat.

As you may (or may not) know, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> has been more or less in charge of maintaining the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, and kept their activities secretive for 'the good of humanity'.

We at the <color=#01B117>College</color> find this to be hogwash, especially in light of recent events. Ever since the <color=yellow>Spire</color> fractured, they've been oddly quiet, holding private meetings at City Hall.
Now, er, bear in mind that what I'm about to ask of you isn't exactly... 'legal'. But hey, you seem like the kind of person that holds truth to a greater standard than law!
The City Council will be holding a series of meetings this week, presumably to be advised by the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> on what to do about the <color=yellow>Spire</color>.
What I need YOU to do (please please please) is to have someone break- er, SNEAK into City Hall one evening, and listen in.
Then, just report back to me, and we'll take it from there!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Hey! I haven't heard much in the way of what happened last night, so I'm hoping everything went well?
...o-oh, is that a report of what happened? Quick, hand it here!
Um... please pardon my hastiness. Time just happens to be of the essence.
...fantastic! I'm just going to go look over this in the back, I'll return once I've read through the entire thing.

Playing Politics.Name: Playing Politics
Stanzas: ...what, are you surprised at how fast I zipped through that? You should see the tomes I have to scroll through at work. *sigh*
But that's enough about my workload. What your, er, 'correspondent' stumbled upon appears to be in line with our fears.
That is to say: the <color=yellow>Spire</color> is crumbling.
This is troubling, to say the least. Although I'm sure that goes without saying. For the past three and a half centuries, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> has granted us with magical prowess.
Its raw power has kept the creatures of the forests at bay, fostering an excellent environment for Kastonia to grow and thrive.
The <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>, of course, was founded as a means to protect the <color=yellow>Spire</color> from any harm. To 'stay the hand of man's greed' as they say.
But their unwarranted protection comes at a price- nobody except for representatives from the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are allowed anywhere near the <color=yellow>Spire</color>.
Information about our city's sentinel is scarce to come by, and I should know. I've scoured every library in the city!

And so it comes to this: we need someone to aid the <color=#01B117>College</color> in our attempts for transparency. I need you to send someone to the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, and bring me back a chunk of the broken shard.
I'll leave your methods up to your discretion, but just know that your efforts will be forever appreciated by the <color=#01B117>College</color>.
Let me know when this task is finished, barkeep. I'll be waiting!

A Lack of Info.Name: A Lack of Info
Stanzas: I'm <color=#D19F7E>Mavis</color>. I represent the <color=#01B117>College of Magical Research and Recovery</color>.
We received your package yesterday, and our researchers were (well, actually I was) able to translate it.
If we're correct, and we normally are, then the <color=yellow>Spire</color> isn't its own source of magic; it somehow gets its magic from somewhere else.
The issue is that our readings of the <color=yellow>Spire</color> vary dramatically, so it's hard to gather any good data.
We could set up an experiment with a device we purchased from the <color=orange>Artificer's Alliance</color>, but, well, we'd need to be near the <color=yellow>Spire</color> for it to work.
And, uh, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> wouldn't be happy to see us tinkering around there.

I even considered scheduling an information exchange between the <color=#01B117>College</color> and <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> leaders, but that would take weeks to set up with our current relations.
Um, of course, you seem to know a few people that are in good standing with them.
Sorry for taking you away from your work. I'll get something to go, and let you get back to it.

The Path Before.Name: The Path Before - Experiment
Stanzas: So, um, the results are back from the experiment already.
Surprised? You should see the stack of papers they give me each day.
We analyzed the measurements from the Flux device, and we found that the magic in the <color=yellow>Spire</color>... well, it isn't exactly fading.
The amplitude of the waves is steadily increasing, meaning that the magical power transmitted from the <color=yellow>Spire</color> fluctuates more and more.
One day, we might get enough magic to power Kastonia for weeks. The next, we might get nothing at all.
We need to study this more. The <color=yellow>Spire</color> might be collapsing because it's bursting with energy, not because it's actually falling apart.
Our only problem is that we still can't get into the <color=yellow>Spire</color> without the city's approval (why is there always paperwork?).
So, er, if there's anything you can say or do to, uh, persuade the leaders- to let the <color=#01B117>College</color> have control over the <color=yellow>Spire</color>- that would... help... a lot.
Sorry for taking you away from your work. I'll get something to go, and let you get back to it.

Your Better Judgement.Name: The Path Before - Ask
Stanzas: Thank you for gathering what information you could from the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>, but, uh, it wasn't... well, it wasn't much to go off of.
I just saw one of the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> members walk out of here. Did he- did he say something to you? Something we don't know?
Because if he did, telling us would only, er, speed up our research (and maybe I'll have time to go home early)
We're incredibly close to figuring out what's wrong. If we just had a little more jurisdiction, we might be able to fix the problem before it becomes worse!
My itinerary says there's another town hall meeting tonight. If you have anything important to share, it would be a, ah, convenient time to do so.

The Path Ahead.Name: The Path Before - Eyes/Relic
Stanzas: I don't mean to, er, interrupt- I imagine you're probably busy! And believe me, I know what it's like to be busy.

But, um... well, I represent the <color=#01B117>College of Magical Research and Recovery</color>, and, er... I was kind of hoping I could speak to you, regarding your work with the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>.
It's not that we think you're trying to prevent our research or anything!
But, uh... we're afraid that somebody as influential as you might, er, unintentionally stall our progress.
We have a lot of theories that could be proven if we could just get into the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, but the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> retains full control of it.
If you know of anything that might sway the public in our favor, we might be able to persuade Kastonia's leaders to let us research there.
Um, here, take my business card. You can contact me any time (hopefully not soon. I have way too much to do). I'm <color=#D19F7E>Mavis</color>, by the way.

Day6CollegeStrong.Name: Day6CollegeStrong
Stanzas: *huff* *huff* ...g-good morning, barkeep! I ran over as soon as I could... I hope you have good news for me?
...Oh my goodness... That's a genuine fragment of the <color=yellow>Spire</color> you have there, isn't it?! I can't believe you actually pulled it off!
I-I don't mean to insinuate that I find you incapable... it's just, this is an impressive feat for a barkeep!
(That didn't come off any better, did it?)
*ahem* Um, a-anyways, I'm appreciative that you were able to acquire this for me- do you mind if I ask how you managed to do so...?
...You had them do WHAT? Ooh dear... if it's all the same with you, I think I might withhold that particular detail when giving the <color=#01B117>College</color> my report.
I don't quite think my superiors would enjoy knowing that they inadvertently assaulted a <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> member, heh...
Regardless, I'm going to have this taken back to be studied. Time is of the essence in this matter, however.
An extra pair of hands would be greatly appreciated, if you find someone willing to help!
Anyways, that's it for me. Maybe a quick drink to keep my energy up?

Day6CollegeSneak.Name: Day6CollegeSneak
Stanzas: *huff* *huff* ...g-good morning, barkeep! I ran over as soon as I could... I hope you have good news for me?
...Oh my goodness... That's a genuine fragment of the <color=yellow>Spire</color> you have there, isn't it?! I can't believe you actually pulled it off!
I-I don't mean to insinuate that I find you incapable... it's just, this is an impressive feat for a barkeep!
(That didn't come off any better, did it?)
*ahem* Um, a-anyways, I'm appreciative that you were able to acquire this for me- do you mind if I ask how you managed to do so...?
...like, the WHOLE fence? How'd they manage to make their way up there, much less without being caught?!
Goodness, that's an incredible tale! I sure hope your patron didn't hurt themselves getting down!
Regardless, I'm going to have this taken back to be studied. Time is of the essence in this matter, however.
An extra pair of hands would be greatly appreciated, if you find someone willing to help!
Anyways, that's it for me. Maybe a quick drink to keep my energy up?

Day7CorporealSidedWithCorporeal.Name: Day7CorporealSidedWithCorporeal
Stanzas: I-I have a lot more paperwork to do now.
The government is set on giving the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> full control over the <color=yellow>Spire</color>.
I'm trying to find a way in, but there aren't many options left for us at the <color=#01B117>College</color>.
To make matters worse, I've combined data gathered from the <color=yellow>Spire</color> with what knowledge we've gained from the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>.
By my estimation, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> will grow so unstable that it will either crumble or explode. Either way, you won't want to be anywhere near here when that happens.
The truth is, we don't have long.
If I'm correct, and I usually am, then we have roughly...
Eight days until the city is leveled.
If I'm not allowed near that <color=yellow>Spire</color> until I have the proper certification, I'll be finished with that paperwork before you can bat an eye.
If I have one superior talent, it's getting things done quickly. Watch. I'll be there alongside the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> before you thought it was possible.

Between Two Barstools.Name: Between Two Barstools
Stanzas: I... I don't know what to say.
I'm not wrong in assuming that it was you who tipped off the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>, am I?
Just... just so TYPICAL. Ugh, I should've KNOWN not to trust...
...*sigh* I'm... I'm sorry. I've just been overworked is all.
I'm... upset, but I understand. I can't just expect you to trust someone who asked you to go behind the back of the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>.
But hey, I'm willing to give you another chance. A chance to side on the right side of history.
That woman that was captured last night? She was a beloved member of the <color=#01B117>College</color>- someone that we can't afford to lose to the prisons.
There will be a trial tonight, after which, I assume she'll probably be shipped off to Bleakmaw Prison for treason.
Please... if you still believe in doing the right thing, help us. Break her out before the trial.

Day7CorporealSidedWithCollege.Name: Day7CorporealSidedWithCollege
Stanzas: Um, I have good news and bad news.
Good news! Thanks to you, we have complete access to the <color=yellow>Spire</color>!
I was able to collect enough data to find a trend in the fluctuations.
If I'm correct, and I usually am, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> will grow so unstable that it will either crumble or explode.
Either way, you won't want to be anywhere near here when that happens.
And, according to the numbers, we only have...
Eight days until the <color=yellow>Spire</color> destroys the city.
We have so much to research, and we barely understand how the <color=yellow>Spire</color> even works!
We'll need to know where the <color=yellow>Spire</color> gets its magic from, what's causing the fluctuations, explore the <color=yellow>Spire</color> itself...
I need to whip up a plan. Until then, sit tight! We have a lot to do in just, um, eight days.
(Breathe, Mavis, you can do this. You have help now.)

Day7SupportCollege.Name: Day7SupportCollege
Stanzas: Thank you, THANK YOU barkeep! I-I don't mean to be too rowdy, but realize that this was a huge help for the College.
What we've learned from the fragment has confirmed our fears- fears that the Corporeal continues to remain silent on.
The Corporeal may wish to oppress our access to knowledge, but these days are limited. We'll seize back our rights soon!
A-anyways... I thank you barkeep. You've been such an instrumental ally in our quest for justice.
I have to get back to the College now, but I promise we'll be in touch soon.
The fight against the Corporeal begins now.

Day7AidCollege.Name: Day7AidCollege
Stanzas: Thank you, THANK YOU barkeep! I-I don't mean to be too rowdy, but realize that this was a huge help for the College.
And I just KNEW that you'd make the right choice in the end. You're one of the good ones.
The Corporeal may wish to oppress our access to knowledge, but these days are limited. We'll seize back our rights soon!
A-anyways... I thank you barkeep. You've been such an instrumental ally in our quest for justice.
I have to get back to the College now, but I promise we'll be in touch soon.
The fight against the Corporeal begins now.

PositiveIntroduction.Name: PositiveIntroduction
Stanzas: I greet you in the name of the <color=yellow>Pantheon</color> and their servants, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>.
I am <color=#5A9399>Gaius</color>, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal's</color> former flag-bearer and current liaison.
I have come for two reasons. First, to thank you for maintaining order yesterday. Second, to ask of you something else.
As you may know, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> is the source of magic for Kastonia.
Our order has warned against using it for millennia, since magic is reserved for the <color=yellow>Pantheon</color> alone.
Now that the <color=yellow>Spire</color> is unstable, the use of magic grows more threatening.
Please help us prevent the further use of magic, to preserve the <color=yellow>Spire</color>. We wish to trust you in this matter.
Once I empty that stein, I shall give to you a scroll containing a sacred text from the <color=yellow>Codex</color>.
Do with it what you will, but know that the stars are ever watchful.

A Matter of Magic.Name: A Matter of Magic
Stanzas: I have returned with the scroll, as promised.
I trust the divines will grant the wisdom you need.

Honor Before Glory.Name: Honor Before Glory
Stanzas: Barkeep. It was you who provided aid to the recent protests, was it not?
Please, don't try to deny it. I'm not here to scold you. In fact, quite the opposite, really.
My name is <color=#5A9399>Gaius</color>, and I am sworn to the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>- Kastonia's venerable defender.
Whereas many of my peers see your act of rebellion as heresy, I see something else: a potential ally of impressive influence.
This belief is strengthened by the fact that you trusted your better judgement, and told us about the <color=#01B117>College</color>'s schemes.
Sure, you may have broken a law or two by slinking past our guards, but this does not discredit your sense of justice!
I'll do what I can to ease the minds of my older colleagues in the matter, and perhaps, in return, you could provide some much-needed assistance?
I've heard whispers that the <color=#01B117>College</color> plans to break into the <color=yellow>Spire</color> tonight- presumably to steal a fragment of the shard that broke off.
Unfortunately, we don't know where they'll strike... and bear in mind, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> has a breathtaking circumference. We can't guard it all by ourselves.
If you could hire one of your patrons to assist us, I can't promise that my superiors would be eternally grateful... but I would be.

Forbidden Actions.Name: Forbidden Actions
Stanzas: Greetings to you, Barkeep. We are fortunate you stand by us.
We were concerned your influence might disturb the path laid before our order, but it is clear we can trust you.
I will be honest with you, Barkeep. The people look to Kastonia's leadership for answers. The leaders, in turn, look to us.
The <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s collapse is a mystery, one foretold in the ancient texts I gave you, but no reason or cure was ever prescribed.
I'm afraid that our last option requires gathering information from another faction, one we have fought for centuries, called the <color=#B70000>Eyes</color>.
I personally wish to avoid them at all costs and have considered another option, one the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> would not favor.
There is a relic that charges around magical entities.
I can stand watch over the <color=yellow>Spire</color> tonight, give the relic to your friend, and gather more information on the <color=yellow>Spire</color>.
I leave the choice to you, as you are the one with the resources to act.

Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Experiment.Name: Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Experiment
Stanzas: It seems the <color=#01B117>College</color> has made a recent discovery.
I would ask how they could obtained such knowledge so quickly, but I believe we already know the answer to that question.
Truly, I am glad they have made progress. This is a catastrophe we must work through together.
But, last night, there was another magical imbalance, and I suspect it is a result of your actions.
You must see that, as magic becomes more unstable, the use of a simple, magical flame might engulf the city. Or, a spell to restore a person to health may have no effect at all.
Those who use magic must be wary. The <color=#01B117>College</color> understands that certain magics must be kept from the common person, but when it comes to their own boundaries...
There are other ways to solve this crisis. You must have faith that, together, we can solve this using the path laid before us.

Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Ask.Name: Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Ask
Stanzas: I am pleased that we can work together once more.
Your friend came to us, seeking information about our ways. I have come to tell you more.
In light of recent events, I was chosen to seek help from the <color=yellow>Seven Stones</color>.
They said, 'In a pool of water, a ripple can only peak as high as its troughs fall. So, too, does the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s strength.'
But, not steadily. It is fluctuating chaotically- rising and falling in strength, more like a tital wave than a ripple.
As it does, the result of magic becomes unpredictable, its use, more dangerous. Imagine a tiny flame engulfing the city, or a life-saving spell having no effect.
I understand your favor with the <color=#01B117>College</color>, but using magic to discover what's wrong with magic is reckless, despite the caster's intelligence.
I trust you will use your better judgement in times such as these.

Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Eyes.Name: Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Eyes
Stanzas: Your friend did well last night. It appears the <color=#B70000>Eyes</color> know things we do not.
They seem to be harnessing magic from the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, no doubt to resurrect their elder god, the <color=red>Titan</color>.
The <color=red>Titan</color>, however, cannot be resurrected by simple magic. No, it can only be revived with Chaos.
If they've been harnessing this power, then the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s magic isn't fading...
But, not steadily. It is fluctuating chaotically- rising and falling in strength.
As it does, the result of magic becomes unpredictable, its use, more dangerous. Imagine a tiny flame engulfing the city, or a life-saving spell having no effect.
Those who use magic must be wary. The <color=#01B117>College</color> understands that certain magics must be kept from the common person, but when it comes to their own boundaries...

Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Relic.Name: Day6CorporealRouteCollege-Eyes
Stanzas: Our disovery last night was... eye-opening... to say the least.
The relic didn't strengthen or weaken within the <color=yellow>Spire</color>
Over time, the pulses grew, its peaks growing stronger, its depths growing weaker.
It is like a pool of water, whose waves grow in size as its troughs fall deeper.
I fear, as well, that our search was not unnoticed. As a result, I have heard false whispers that the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are divided.
Perhaps it would be better to keep the details of our search quiet.

Day6CorporealStrong.Name: Day6CorporealStrong
Stanzas: Your actions last night may seem trivial to you, but let me assure you that your efforts will not go unnoticed.
Now that we are no longer strained between politics and guarding the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, we can focus on what truly matters: solving the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s collapse.
A trial will be held for her this evening, in which we will publicly denounce the College and their schemes.
There is much to learn of the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s history, and we must learn it quickly- within eight days time if I overheard your conversation accurately.
We must seek aid from our ancestors, the stars, ancient ruins, and the <color=yellow>Spire</color> itself.
We will work closely in the days to come. I pray we can work the others as well.

Day6CorporealSmart.Name: Day6CorporealSmart
Stanzas: Your actions last night may seem trivial to you, but let me assure you that your efforts will not go unnoticed.
We managed to capture the thief who sought to put our city's security at risk, and it's all thanks to you.
A trial will be held for her this evening, in which we will publicly denounce the College and their schemes.
I know that asking more from you is unfair, but these are dire times, I'm afraid. We at the Corporeal would appreciate your testimony in the matter
We must seek aid from our ancestors, the stars, ancient ruins, and the Spire itself.
We will work closely in the days to come. I pray we can work the others as well.

Between Two Barstools.Name: Between Two Barstools
Stanzas: I am <color=#5A9399>Gaius</color>, knight of the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>. I believe we need to speak.
Your actions last night have put us in a difficult spot. It is our duty to remain a stalwart defender of the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, and as of last night, we've failed in our task.
One of your acquaintances made off with a fragment of the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, despite our best efforts at defense.
Let me be clear- the only reason you're not in chains right now is because I have yet to relay this information to my superiors.
And my negligence in this matter is not due to pity, nor is it due to a change of faith.
I believe that people deserve the chance to prove themselves, and, if anything, all you stand guilty of is being misinformed.
The <color=#01B117>College</color> means to make information about the <color=yellow>Spire</color> public- information that we cannot allow to fall into the hands of the wrong people.
For this reason, I need your help. Please send one of your connections to stop them, by any means necessary.
If this information about the <color=yellow>Spire</color> becomes publicized, then Kastonia- and perhaps, the world- is doomed.
I will leave you to dwell on this now. I do hope that you make the right decision- your patrons' lives may very well depend on it.

Day7CorporealSidedWithCorporeal.Name: Day7CorporealSidedWithCorporeal
Stanzas: We cannot thank you enough for your influence on the city council.
Now that we are no longer strained between politics and guarding the <color=yellow>Spire</color>, we can focus on what truly matters: solving the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s collapse.
Know, Barkeep, that our story is only beginning.
There is much to learn of the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s history, and we must learn it quickly- within eight days time if I overheard your conversation accurately.
We must seek aid from our ancestors, the stars, ancient ruins, and the <color=yellow>Spire</color> itself.
We will work closely in the days to come. I pray we can work the others as well.

Day7CorporealSidedWithCollege.Name: Day7CorporealSidedWithCollege
Stanzas: I do not doubt your intentions. I understand them to be good.
However, the <color=#01B117>College</color> recently gained access to the <color=yellow>Spire</color> because of your influence.
If they are not careful, they may hasten the <color=yellow>Spire</color>'s ruin.
As always, we shall be dutiful, ensuring the <color=yellow>Spire</color> remains intact.
But I believe it is time for me to act of my own accord- to take action where I see none.
I shall journey beyond <color=yellow>Seven Stones</color> to seek aid from the <color=yellow>Pantheon</color> itself.
Be sure that the <color=yellow>Spire</color> remains intact while I am away.

Day7SupportCorporeal.Name: Day7SupportCorporeal
Stanzas: You can rest easily, knowing that the Spire fragment is safe and secure, back in our hands.
This act of honor will not be forgotten, I can promise you. I am eternally grateful for your help in the matter.
And I believe it's high time that I be honest with you about the state of the Spire. You've proven yourself a worthy ally, after all.
As I'm sure you know, the Spire's magic is what keeps this city safe- a gift from the gods, to repel any unwanted aggressors.
However, as of late, the magic within the Spire has become... unstable.
So much so, that we fear it may shatter itself in its entirety, one day. And that day may be soon.
When that happens, Kastonia will undoubtedly be devastated. It's at times like this that we will need to look inwards for help.
I'll elaborate at a later date... when we've figured out what our next step will be.

Day7AidCorporeal.Name: Day7AidCorporeal
Stanzas: Thanks to your testimony, the thief has been brought to justice, and will be imprisoned.
Furthermore, this allows us to finally take action against the treacherous College, whose eyes have been set on us from their inception.
But this needs not concern you. Not yet, at least... although I may need to enlist your help in the future, should you choose to accept it.
And I believe it's high time that I be honest with you about the state of the Spire. You've proven yourself a worthy ally, after all.
As I'm sure you know, the Spire's magic is what keeps this city safe- a gift from the gods, to repel any unwanted aggressors.
However, as of late, the magic within the Spire has become... unstable.
So much so, that we fear it may shatter itself in its entirety, one day. And that day may be soon.
When that happens, Kastonia will undoubtedly be devastated. It's at times like this that we will need to look inwards for help.
I'll elaborate at a later date... when we've figured out what our next step will be.
...or maybe that confused look on your face means that you're still working on learning the ropes? Hah!

Now You Know Me.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Name's <color=orange>Jim</color>. I've been a patron of your parents since they opened this place!
...you still seem a little rattled. Tell you what, why don't I give you a helping hand! It's the least I can do for your parents' decades of service.
To start off, why don't you make me a <color=yellow>drink</color>? Been a while since I've had one of your parent's expert brews.
It shouldn't be all that hard. Each of the taps are <color=yellow>color-coded</color> after all, ho ho!

Jim Explains Rumors.Name: Jim Explains Rumors
Stanzas: Whoa there- looks like one of your patrons has given you a <color=yellow>quest</color>!
...what're you giving me that look for? You didn't think that serving drinks was your ONLY job as a bartender, right?
Whether wittingly or unwittingly, people tend to spill all sorts of <color=yellow>interesting problems</color> to whomever provides them alcohol.
It's up to you to help resolve these issues in the most efficient way- by passing them off to another patron and bribing them with drinks- ho ho!
This first one's easy- you just need someone to pick up your bartending certification, right?
Why not just ask the first person to come through the bar next? I'll take a seat in the back, just in case.

EndDay1.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Looks like you had a fairly successful first day!
I'm gonna head on out so you can close up shop, but don't worry- I'll be here bright and early in the morn'!

Day 2 Intro.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Mornin', kid! Y'know, I'm starting to get used to it being you behind that bar instead of your folks.
Despite your age, you actually make for a pretty good barkeep. Ho ho!
Now then, why don't you pour me a-

The Commotion.Name: Jim
Stanzas: ...holy smokes- kid, did you feel that?
I don't think it's just me... I only had a couple drinks before stopping by!
Felt almost like an <color=red>earthquake</color>, but a lot more violent and sudden. I wonder what's happened?
Whoa, whoa, hold on now- I see that look of eager curiosity in your eyes, but you've got a bar to run, right?
Why don't you have send another one of your patrons off? I know Deidre is a fairly perceptive lass, she may be best suited to the task.
And it'll give you the opportunity to keep doing your job! Speaking of which...

After Sending Deidre.Name: Jim
Stanzas: And now we wait! Ol' Deidre may be a little... eccentric, but I can speak to her reliability.
Also, you may have realized this already, but your efforts to help out don't go unnoticed.
The more tasks you hand out to folks, the more chummy they'll tend to be with you.
And who knows? Maybe you'll end up <color=yellow>learning something new about them</color> in the process!
Anyways, I'm gonna go nurse this drink in the back for a while and let you tend the bar. Best of luck!

Your Civic Duty.Name: Your Civic Duty
Stanzas: So I take it you've heard the news by now, hmm? After all, it's not like you can't see it from here, ho ho!
Of course, I don't mean to make light of this situation. The <color=yellow>Spire</color> has been our benefactor of magical power for as long as anyone can remember.
After all, that's why Kastonia was built around that looming tower!
But I digress... there's not much that can be done about the <color=yellow>Spire</color> now, but the devastation caused by yesterday's event is still very present.
I know this isn't quite what you signed up for, kid, but maybe you could see about sending another patron off to provide aid? The city could use it.
Here, I'll hand this off to you while you think it over.

Day7TeaserCorporeal.Name: Day7TeaserCorporeal
Stanzas: Who was that, kid? Someone from the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>?
Seems like you got a lot on your plate- serving drinks, wading through factions, coordinating the <color=yellow>Spire</color> crisis... and it's only been a week!
I can only imagine what'll happen in these next several days!
Until then, you'd better rest up. You've got a lot to do!
I'm lookin' forward to seeing what you accomplish.

Day7TeaserCollege.Name: Day7TeaserCollege
Stanzas: Who was that, kid? Someone from the <color=#01B117>College</color>?
Seems like you got a lot on your plate- serving drinks, wading through factions, coordinating the <color=yellow>Spire</color> crisis... and it's only been a week!
I can only imagine what'll happen in these next several days!
Until then, you'd better rest up. You've got a lot to do!
I'm lookin' forward to seeing what you accomplish.

Day7CollegeCollege.Name: Day7CollegeCollege
Stanzas: Hoo boy, you sure've lit a fire between those two factions, haven't you?
Ho ho, I'm kidding, kid. They've always been like this...
...although that little girl doesn't mince words, does she? Kastonia may be in for some dark days ahead.
But hey, that's what we need you for, right? Someone to pour drinks and lend an ear.
As far as I'm concerned, this bar's the real bastion of Kastonia. And you're the kid that's gonna keep this city from tearing itself apart.
I imagine your work isn't done yet. *wink*

Day7CollegeCorporeal.Name: Day7CollegeCorporeal
Stanzas: Hoo boy, you sure've lit a fire between those two factions, haven't you?
Ho ho, I'm kidding, kid. They've always been like this...
...although that knight doesn't mince words, does he? Kastonia may be in for some dark days ahead.
But hey, that's what we need you for, right? Someone to pour drinks and lend an ear.
As far as I'm concerned, this bar's the real bastion of Kastonia. And you're the kid that's gonna keep this city from tearing itself apart.
I imagine your work isn't done yet. *wink*

GDC Tutorial End.Name: GDC Tutorial End
Stanzas: Goodness! That sounded rather foreboding, didn't it? I wonder what they meant by that.
Unfortunately for you, the devs aren't willing to divulge that information quite yet. What a bunch of teases, ho ho!
However, I have good news. If you're interested in keeping up with this game's development cycle, you can follow the devs on Twitter!
Check them out at <color=yellow>@ArmsAndAle</color>, and give them a follow! I'm sure they'd appreciate it.
Well, alright kid. That's about all I've got for now. Hopefully I'll be seeing you soon.
Watch out for the release of <color=yellow>'A Tale of Arms and Ale'</color> this coming May!
